author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Package name similar to 2 existing packages.
1. Similar to MLJBase. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
2. Similar to MLBase. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

i fixed the issue and added the upperbounds.

`[noblock]`

The name, AMLPBase, is an abbreviation of AutoMLPipeline base.

`[noblock]`

I can't merge (and don't really want that responsibility!); I just label things for the name similarity check, and here the labels are to say I didn't think the name would be visually confused with the names of the other packages listed in the comment (or that one would accidentally type this name instead of the other names due to a typo), which are the main concerns of the name similarity check from my point of view.

Probably a maintainer will get back to you soon!
thanks! went to the slack channel now for pkg-registration

>The name, AMLPBase, is an abbreviation of AutoMLPipeline base.

So it's not related to (which means something different):
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMPL

and IBM's CPLEX?

Should the name rather be AutoMLPipelineBase.jl? I.e. be specific, it's not like most users would ever type this in?

FYI: You can do:
```
pkg> add https://github.com/IBM/AMLPBase.jl
```

and add your other package, I see how it's blocking registering that one, and you wouldn't just want to document that users have to do this first; as a temporary measure you can do such add for both.
it won't be just the base for AutoMLPipeline.jl but also TSML.jl. I can change it AMLPipelineBase.jl
